Key Match Events: The Rays lost their third straight game, getting swept by the Phillies.
Shane Baz struck out four batters and retired the final 12 hitters he faced.
Nick Castellanos hit a two-run homer in the first inning.
Jonathan Aranda hit a home run in the sixth inning.
The Rays finished 1-for-9 with runners in scoring position, dropping their season average with RISP to an MLB-worst .214.
Post-Match Reflections: Taylor Walls expressed frustration over the team's inability to capitalize on scoring opportunities.
Rodney Linares, acting manager, commented on the team's struggles with runners in scoring position.
Drew Rasmussen reflected on the team's competitiveness against the Phillies.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rays are now seven games out of the final American League Wild Card spot.
